storyInfo: The Infected Victorian soldiers do not join the Reunion. Before setting out to look for an abandoned medicine factory, Reunion finds the Infected sergeant's shattered body.

attributes.text: The first time I saw an Infected shatter was in the middle of a lake.
\nI was seven, young and innocent. It was my dream to become captain of the Miner's Patrol.
\nI'd get to stay up late at night, wear a cool uniform, and walk around with a bright torch.
\nMost families in Rim Billiton made their living in mining, digging, and processing ore. We did everything to prevent Infection.
But accidents happen.
One day, the adults came home early.
\nMother and the other women of the house whispered in a corner. The men smoked in silence, until the entire room was filled with that acrid scent.
\nIn between coughs, I ran around the living room, pretending to be a surveyor looking for new veins in a fog-filled valley.
\nDad grabbed me by the collar and put me to bed.
I woke up earlier than usual the next day. I think I was trying to grab a can of soda while nobody was watching.
\nGrandma was sitting in the living room next to her luggage, She said she was going on a journey.
I pestered her to let me go with her. She could never say no to me. She said I could come a short way with her, then I had to go back home.
We saw a salt lake in the distance. It was a shallow one that only appeared in the rainy season, but it rained a lot that year. We couldn't see the other side of the lake.
\nGrandma told me that was as far as I could go. I said alright. She made me promise, like when she made me promise I would be a good boy when I first went to school.
\nBut I wasn't a good boy anymore. I quietly followed her, hiding behind a bush when she got to the lakeside.
Grandma got onto a boat with a few people on it. They all had strange stones growing out of their bodies, and one of them was wrapped up in a blanket. The boatman turned on the engine.
\nI watched from the shore as the boat disappeared into the fog.
I was confused. Grandma didn't say anything to me on our way; it was like an ordinary picnic trip.
\nI was about to turn around, thinking about where I would have breakfast before going home, then I heard a sound like crystal shattering.
I turned around and saw Originium dust sprayed into the air, mixing with the fog, reflecting an eerie glow in the sun.
\nIt was like a dream.

attributes.content: Was that how you got infected?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: No, I was lucky. That time.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Maybe it really was a dream, brought about by a summer morning.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: But I never saw Grandma again, and my family never talked about her anymore.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: She...
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: She was always thoughtful and cautious. It wasn't like her to let a child follow her, putting him in danger.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: For once, though, she made a selfish choice on her journey.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: She wanted to spend just a little more time with her grandson. Maybe she even wanted to give me a hug.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Now I remember. I didn't even get to show her my report card that semester.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: It was the best I ever did in school.
The sounds of the forest stopped. The flickering light shining through the shadows of the trees no longer moved.
\nThen, came the sound of lament and painful moaning.

attributes.content: On your guard, Red. The Victorians have stopped.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Looks like they're planning to make camp.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Here? It's only a few hundred meters from our camp.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: They no longer have the strength to cover their tracks. Who knows if there's a scouting party shadowing them somewhere.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.text: Red's hands never stop, even as he complains, cutting away the bothersome vines.
\nWe approach their position and see their flickering shadows through the sparse bushes.
\nSoldiers lie on the ground in exhaustion, hopelessly burying their heads amongst the falling leaves. The sergeant sits down on a rock, silently polishing his sword, the only weapon he has left.

attributes.content: I guess they just didn't have the strength to go any further.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: These people don't have the luxury to think. They're still living in a dream.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: 'It'll all pass.'
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Were they really just 'separated' from the rest of the army?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: These Victorians are lucky. They faced a gentle exile, not the swords of their comrades.
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: It's not easy to accept that you're Infected.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: We should wait for them to understand who they are, and for them to make a choice.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Do you really mean to take them in? These... 'soldiers'?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: We're weak. So are they.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: What's the plan, then?
attributes.name: Red

attributes.content: Finish the shift, and notify the sentries. Expand the patrols to include this camp.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The Infected stand together.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: 'Stand Together.' Pretty words.
Of course we had to stand together. What other choice did we have?
\nBut are the words 'stand together' so simple that we fail to appreciate their true meaning?
\nOripathy changed all our lives equally, robbed us of our futures equally.
But is what is taken from a farmer who has to pay his taxes out of seeds stored for next year's planting equal to what is taken from a wealthy merchant with a safe full of pure gold?
\nWhen what we had to begin with was not equal, neither are the choices that survive deprivation.
\nWho are we really standing together with, then?

attributes.content: You're Talulah, right?
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: Founder of the Reunion, leader of the Infected! They say you did great things in Ursus!
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: All the Infected of Victoria are talking about you. Is it true that you captured a city?
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: A city for the Infected? Is it still there?
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: I'm no leader. I'm just a member of the Reunion Movement.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Have some porridge. We're setting out soon.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Tell us more about your city, Talulah!
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: It's...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Oh, no need to hang your head! I suppose things didn't go so smoothly, if you're in Victoria now.
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: Of course the uninfected wouldn't let us win that easily, after trampling on us for so long.
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: What does it matter if those scum tripped you up once? You're Reunion!
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: We all believe in you!
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.text: Talulah looks down at the pot she is stirring, serving bowl after bowl of hot porridge.
\nThe steam from the pot obscures her vision.

attributes.content: Careful, it's hot.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: They all believe in you.
attributes.name: Reunion Soldier

attributes.content: What do you think about that, eh? Being the hope of so many?
attributes.name: Reunion Soldier

attributes.content: You're a veteran from Ursus, aren't you? What are you talking about?
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: Valiya.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I know... sorry, couldn't resist. Hmph.
attributes.name: Reunion Soldier

attributes.content: Is it true that there was a bit of trouble at the camp yesterday?
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: It's fine. All taken of.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Stop crowding Talulah like that and start packing. We have a long way to go today.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Oh yeah, I still have fertilizer to load onto the truck.
attributes.name: Nervous Infected

attributes.content: And it's not 'You Reunion' any more.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Oh yeah, we're Reunion too. Haha!
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: See you later.
attributes.name: Excited Infected

attributes.content: Guard...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It's fine. No need to say anything.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: I take the bowl of porridge from Talulah. She's very pale.

attributes.content: There are things we can't tell them yet.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I know. It's your decision.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Reunion can't collapse again.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'm the banner that you rally to in Victoria. I accept that.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: But I'm deceiving them. I'm still...
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: It's no more or less than you deserve.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: It's none of my business whether you see this as an honor or punishment for your crimes. What the others need is hope.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Are you going to tell them you were under the influence of an evil god, and everything that happened at Chernobog was an Ursine plot?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I would rather our organization be built on a lie.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: We were built on a lie back then too.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I know. Payback will come, someday, but at least this time we lied for the Infected.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: There are no second chances for Reunion. I hope we don't go down the same path you did.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: What did that sister of yours say in Chernobog?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: 'Until the day when the Infected are judged fairly.'
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'll wait.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I'll be your tool until that day comes.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Er, excuse me...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: What are you doing here, Victorian?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'm not armed. Your sentries searched me.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I... I caught a whiff. My brothers haven't eaten in four days. Some of them... I don't know, they don't look good.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I have a lighter here, and... d-do you want brass buttons? If you could be so kind as to trade some bread for these...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I-I know, it's not enough... I have a bunch of good leather back at my home in Blackstream! Once I get back, I'll sell it and pay you back double!
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.text: The young man gazes hungrily at the pot, his hand grabbing his own uniform tightly, perhaps out of nervousness, or trying to straighten it out to look more presentable.
\nTalulah puts a bowl of porridge before him.

attributes.content: You can take what's left in the pot.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Th-Thank you! Here's the lighter. Sometimes you need to click it a few times before it lights. And the button
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.text: I take the lighter and grab the hand trying to rip the buttons off.

attributes.content: It's fine. Eat.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: He practically pours the food down his throat.

attributes.content: Where's your sergeant?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I don't know. We haven't seen him all morning. I was worried he would barge into your camp again.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Say, did you hear any sounds in the night? Like artillery fire?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: No reports of anything like that.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: He... never mind. Everyone's gone mad. Us, them, there's no sane man left on the front.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Sound like things are rough out there.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Rough, eh...? You have no idea what the Sarkaz are using against us.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: They have no battleships, no armored vehicles. We thought the devils were just barbarians, fighting our armies with swords and bows.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: How wrong we were. Could you imagine an entire squad of Sarkaz casters, casting their Arts at the same time?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: It was more terrifying than any artillery or ballista fire. Get hit by a shell, and you might lose an arm or leg, the fragments digging themselves into your flesh, causing terrible pain.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: But the Sarkaz, they turned the battlefield to the Hell of Lateran tales.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I saw armored vehicles pierced by lightning bolts of blood, my mates melted into puddles of gore...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: I never imagined it would turn out like this when the Duke of Fife's men dragged me out of the cystybeast pens
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Forget it. I'd rather not think about anything. Thanks for the porridge. I'll bring the pot back later.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: You can keep it. We have plenty of them, and it might be of use to you.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Thank you so much. I'll never forget it. Are you leaving? Where are you going?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: This is pretty much a battlefield now, and it's Victorian lands all around... for the Infected...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Oh, I'm sorry, I shouldn't have asked. Forget I said anything.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.text: The soldier hurries to leave, grabbing the side of the pot with his one good hand and supporting the bottom with the limp arm, grimacing at the heat.
\nI reach into my pocket and dig out what I just got from the doctor.

attributes.content: Hey, wait!
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: I go up to him and put the vial of medicine in his pocket.

attributes.content: What's this?
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: It'll relieve some of the worst symptoms. You can share it with the others.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'll visit Blackstream and collect what you owe me.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Isir...
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Go.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: ...You'll love our village.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: Thanks.
attributes.name: Injured Soldier

attributes.content: You really are like the Rhodes Islanders.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: I heard you were the one who found the doctors who knew how to make the medicine.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: To be honest, what we're making hardly even qualifies as medicine compared to the suppressants that I knew.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Rhodes Island offers low-cost treatment plans, but at the end of the day, they're a company. They need research funding, and they have corporate due diligence to deal with.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Who knows how many eyes are on them in Kazimierz and Columbia?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: That's why you persuaded Nine to go north. The warriors say there's a factory there.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: A tiny pharmaceutical factory.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: So small it's barely even a workshop. It's not even on a nomadic plate, but that one little piece of land was once the salvation of many Infected.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: That, is, until it grew big enough that it caught people's attention. Some of the ones driven out of there joined us, and that's how we heard the story.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: It's deep in the forest, where nobody's watching. We need medicine, even if it's just a pale imitation of the real thing. But more importantly
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: It was once a starting point of Victoria's Reunion Movement.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: We have to unite those scattered across Victoria. We have to tell them that help has come.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I've seen plenty of Infected self-help organizations. Kind souls helped us from time to time, but in the end, none of them lasted.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: When I was at Rhodes Island, I often wondered if things would get better if everyone worked harder and made more medicine.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Maybe. But Chernobog changed my mind.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Why do they crack down on workshops like these? Why are kindness and hard work warped by hatred and prejudice?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: When evil itself is fuzzy as the fog, why does everyone, even the Infected themselves, decide to wait for their own deaths in the middle of a lake?
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: I stare at Talulah, who hardly reacts to my words. Her eyes are calm, unusually so.
\nHer soul is too weary, having seen too much. What has become of the woman who was once our leader?
\nOr had she uttered the same words before, and seen what came of them?

attributes.content: *sigh*... You know what I mean.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Oripathy is an illness, but... we'll leave the illnesses to Rhodes Island, for now.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Our enemy isn't just Oripathy; it's oppression and prejudice, the truths they've tried to cover up with Oripathy.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Oripathy is just the culmination of all the decay across the lands.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Taking back a symbol may help the Infected of Victoria realize that and stand together with us.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: ...Stand together.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: That's something only Reunion can do.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Have you told the others how you think?
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Hm? Of course. I'm always talking to Nine about our
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: No. You know the one I'm talking about.
attributes.name: Talulah

attributes.content: Oh...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: A little. I got a... gentle answer. That's why I'm here.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Whatever the case, we didn't choose the same path, so I... er...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: It's not my place to ask for more.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: Of course it isn't.
Rhodes Island is a paradise of idealists. Me? A man who could only see what stands right in front of me.
\nThe gain and loss right in front of me...
I heard the veteran guerilla fighters talk about the old days of the Reunion in the tundra, the ideals that everyone held.
\n'A city of the Infected, our home.'
\nSome of them thought it was just within reach. It was almost realized at Chernobog, but fell short in the end.
But I know the city of our dreams is still far, far away.
\nAnd how could a single city be enough?
\nWhat could a single city do?

attributes.content: You're still limping. Maybe you should go sit in the back?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Just a little sprain.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: You haven't been on a lot of expeditions lately.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: My squad passed through the wilderness the other day with Infected comrades from Greewich.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: The earth had been torn open, with ditches everywhere. Looked like one of the turnip farms back home, except much smaller.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I tripped.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: *snort*
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: What was it? I didn't think there a place like that near Londinium.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Walt said that all those trenches, hundreds of them, each one big enough to fit our entire squad, were battleship tread marks.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: No wonder you've looked worried.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: It takes all my strength just to go from day to day.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Don't think too much about it.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: A report from the scouts, Guard.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: We heard sounds from the woods on the left side up ahead.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: The Originium zone sensor went off when we got closed, so we couldn't be sure exactly what it was.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: Send word to the rest of the team. We'll go around.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Roger.
attributes.name: Reunion Member

attributes.content: Percival.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: I'll come along with a few guys. Don't want you to trip again.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.text: There's an unsettling smell in the air.
\nThe instruments show a high level of Active Originium. Not a good sign.

attributes.content: Remember your protective measures. Keep your masks on.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: Was that a man under the tree?
No, it's a Victorian uniform, ripped almost beyond recognition, but somehow familiar. A sergeant's badge lies on the ground next to it.
\nA tiny music box sits a short distance away, covered in Originium dust, but still barely playing.

attributes.content: ...Infected confirmed dead. We should leave.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.text: Percival walks slowly, humming along with the scattered music.

attributes.content: Do you know this song, Guard?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: No, but I've heard it before.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: ...The sun on the meadow is summery warmFilling our home with euphoria
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: We gather together to greet the stormTomorrow belongs to Victoria
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: The Victorian national anthem.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Our teacher made us sing it over and over until we had it memorized when I was littlebefore I got sick.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: It's been a long time since I last heard it.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I was born in Victoria. By all accounts, I should be Victorian. But what about now?
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: That sergeant believed he belonged to Victoria to the very end.
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: He was lucky. He didn't get to go through... everything he would have gone through.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: The reason I called myself Reunion
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: I was tired of being punched, being thrown out of factories before I got paid, being kept out of even the cheapest hostel rooms, no matter how much money I had on me.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: The Reunion Movement showed me another path, besides suffering and dying in silence. That was all I needed.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: Even if the price was abandoning my family, my country, and everything else I had.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: In fact, I had lost all of it the moment the first crystal popped through my skin. But it took me a long time to get it.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: All of us, Ursine, Columbian, Victorian, Sarkaz, Feline, Liberi...
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: We are all Reunion.
attributes.name: Percival

attributes.content: If we have to cross every battlefront, every war zone, every corpse-laden ruin, in order for our deaths to be seen and heard...
attributes.name: Guard

attributes.content: Then we'll cross them.
attributes.name: Guard
